derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English , from ecclesiastical Latin, from Greek amēn, from Hebrew 'āmēn 'truth, certainty', used adverbially as expression of agreement, and adopted in the Septuagint as a solemn expression of belief or affirmation

entry.tran: 阿门（基督教徒祈祷结束时用语）
entry.def: Amen is said by Christians at the end of a prayer.

example.ex: In the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Ghost, Amen.
